extends java.lang.Object
    The main view of our application.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        called when the activity is requested, used to initialize most of the view elements and start the main application flow. The applications main user is asserted and set after which the primary user is setup.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                Intent data)
        Callback for startActivityForResult, this will help delay the call of afterUserSetup until we have setup an application username in configuration. This will get called upon exit of the InitializeUserActivity intent.
        Parameters:
        requestCode -
        resultCode -
        data -

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Close the navigation menu if it is open, else, delegate back button press to base class.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        handler called to inflate the options menu.
        Parameters:
        menu - menu to inflate a layout into
        Returns:
        true == success, false == failure

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Handler for options menu item clicks, User primarily to enter the configuration view of the application.
        Parameters:
        item - the menu item that was selected
        Returns:
        true == success, false == failure

      • onNavigationItemSelected

        public boolean onNavigationItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Toggle between the different fragments in the navigation menu, this handler will swap out the requested fragment and replace the nav bar title.
        Parameters:
        item - the navigation menu item that was selected
        Returns:
        success == true, failure == false.

        Load the first fragment and load the username and email fields of the nav bar header.
